column1: 5 - VALUE OF RETAIL SALES BY COMMODITY AT CURRENT PRICES NON-SEASONALLY ADJUSTED
This worksheet contains five tables presented vertically with a blank row between each table
The monthly period consists of 4 weeks except for March, June, September and December which are 5 weeks. January 2020 is also a 5 week period.
Some cells in this table are empty because data was not collected for these variables at these time points.
Estimates in this table have been produced by combining a breakdown of commodity sales from 53 large retailers with total sales from other retailers.
The quarterly indices are the weighted averages of the monthly indices for the months within the quarter, the weights being the number of weeks in each monthly period.

In July 2018, we increased our sample for the commodity breakdown from 31 to 54 retailers to improve coverage and better represent the commodities sold. Growth rates may not be comparable as a result. This does not impact the main retail sales data.
Index numbers of sales per week - Annually
